Description: The National Historic Chemical Landmarks Program is created.
The first National Historical Chemical Landmark is awarded to the Bakelizer, the steam pressure vessel used to commercialize the first completely synthetic plastic (Bakelite).

The first ACS International Chemical Sciences Chapter is created in Saudi Arabia. The SAISCS-ACS chapter was founded in 1988 and incorporated as a recognized ACS affiliate in 1993, adopting the goals, objectives, and organizational purpose as the ACS.
National Chemistry Day expands to National Chemistry Week, cementing ACS's commitment to scientific outreach.
CAS SciFinder is introduced, giving scientists access to CAS databases without needing to learn a command language.
C&EN Online debuts, introducing world-class science reporting to the internet.
